solution.text:
Total Number of people between the ages of 40 and 60 years: _{{m+k+l+m+j+k-2+m+j+k+n+k}}_
Total Number of people between the ages of 40 and 60 with two electronic devices : _{{m+j}}_

\(P(E) = \frac{Number\;of\;trials\;in\;which\;E\;has\;happened}{Total\;number\;of\;trials}\)

Therefore, the probability of the given individual having two electronic devices:
\( P(E) = \frac{_{{m+j}}_}{_{{m+k+l+m+j+k-2+m+j+k+n+k}}_} = _{{Fraction((m+j),(m+k+l+m+j+k-2+m+j+k+n+k))}}_\)

content.text: What is the probability that a person between 40 and 60 years old has two electronic devices? (Enter your answer as a simplified fraction)
